intro: Tecoma stans var. velutina, commonly known as velvet trumpetbush, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped yellow flowers that bloom in clusters along the branches. The leaves are typically ovate to lanceolate, with a velvety texture that gives the plant its common name. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. This variety is closely related to other species in the Bignoniaceae family, sharing similar growth habits and floral structures.
